channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @DrKittensaurus @margaritaloxas See also: The moral results (in aggregate) of the 2010 passage of the #ACA, by generating massive political opposition and delaying the possibility of ‘single-payer’ or other universal insurance schemes for potentially _decades_, could go either way in the eye of history.

@DrKittensaurus @margaritaloxas Perhaps in addition to encouraging this knowledge among HCWs, the ethics (and cognitive biases) of how to properly employ (or situationally how not to employ) that knowledge in various scenarios could also be taught, to head off those undesirable outcomes.

@DrKittensaurus @margaritaloxas Perhaps those resulting inequalities will be what it takes to rethink and reform health care funding? If most people don’t realize the scale of the problem until _their own_ family falls into medical debt, then most people won’t prioritize working/voting to fix the root causes.
@dima7b @compodeth @Osinttechnical The profits from them also are likely helping fund the invasion?

@6502_ftw @albert_hubble @PhillipsPOBrien Exactly! Intelligence / targeting & force protection also limits rate of fire. [FWIW, and at the risk of sounding pedantic, the article based those numbers on the capacity of a C5 (Super ?) Galaxy, not the more nimble but ~much~ smaller C-130 Hercules.] https://t.co/V0DTpTSi3j
@MontyBoa99 @ginnyhogan_ @invisiblelad007 Even mistranslated as such, the sentiment remains.
@albert_hubble @PhillipsPOBrien https://t.co/gGyYRjz4r0
@6502_ftw @hallam @PhillipsPOBrien @markos “A C-5 cargo plane can carry 140 tons of cargo, or 56 rocket pods—just 10-12 hours of fire missions for a single launcher.”

@MIL_STD @andexihaeienni Nothing saying one with limited military vehicles couldn’t use both: commercial trucks for some areas and military ones for others. Also a combination, in a ‘relay’ fashion (i.e. commercial for medium/long distance, then transfer to military for ‘last-mile’ off-road delivery).
@PeterHall51 @itscollmc @Strandjunker Sadly, the capital markets tend to show quite little concern towards ‘long-term’ anything.
@dabrams2021 @noclador Something like: the US version uses some near-NATO-standard(?) encrypted comm links, which are incompatible with the data systems that Ukraine uses.

@jtasakorn @noclador Probably the modular PGK(?) fuzes, which screw on in place of regular fuzes and which have internal electronics and tiny nose fins for course corrections.
@jtasakorn @noclador https://t.co/G0EIkCMidg

@AansPaa @PinheiroFilJoa @OScottson @IAPonomarenko Explosives-laden rail boxcar. Trigger using any combination of barometric pressure / time / accelerometer triggers (since the altitude profile of the route can be easily calculated from publicly available data).
@Borners1 @kamilkazani Several hundred years of gradual adjustment?
@schneierblog https://t.co/6WjLH0zRsf
@VAFramer @ToriGlass @jonsteingard Probably for a similar reason to how they justify not being able to always perfectly replicate food in that fictional universe: https://t.co/NNMiagmmCI
